com.itko.lisa.test

Class Hook

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.test.Hook

  • public abstract class Hook
extends java.lang.Object
    Hook - a mechanism in LISA to provide start and end test logic globally LISA provides companions as a way to default start and end test logic on a test-by-test basis. But there was a growing need for customers to have an opportunity to define start and end logic for every test run in LISA. To do this with companions meant that customers would have to make sure they added the custom companion to every test. That is error prone. So this hook mechanism was designed. The list of hooks are registered as a property in the current LISA state. Typically they will be defined as a system property in lisa.properties. But this can be overridden by the Configuration if needed.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • startupHook

        public abstract void startupHook(TestExec ts)
                          throws TestRunException
        Called when the test has just been initialized on the simulator and is about to start. This occurs after the test case has been initialized and prepared but before companions are run. There may be times that you wish to prevent the test from even running. That can be accomplished by throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        ts - - the test state for this test
        Throws:
        TestRunException - if you wish to prevent the test from running at all, you can throw this exception with the reason as the detail in the exception

      • endHook

        public abstract void endHook(TestExec ts)
        Called after the test has completed, companions have been run; this is almost the last instruction of the test.
        Parameters:
        ts - - the test state for this test

      • getStartingLongMsg

        public java.lang.String getStartingLongMsg()
        Returns:
        startup hook functionality description

      • getEndedLongMsg

        public java.lang.String getEndedLongMsg()
        Returns:
        ended hook functionality description

      • setLongMsg

        public void setLongMsg(boolean isStarting,
              java.lang.String msg)
        Provides informational message of the hook for Portal Test Monitoring
        Parameters:
        isStarting - boolean to indicate if this is startup hook or ended hook
        msg - functionality description for the hook
